alert.note: Alert for Boone; Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Northwest Webster; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 5:55AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, Nicholas, southeastern Kanawha, southern Braxton, southeastern Roane, north central Raleigh, west central Webster, Clay, western Fayette and northeastern Boone Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 553 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Big Otter to 8 miles northeast of Madison. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. Yeager Airport at Charleston gusted to 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds of 40 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Clay, Oak Hill, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Ansted, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Addison (Webster Springs), Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Camden-On-gauley, Birch River, Burnwell and Powellton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 32 and 60. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 52 and 93. Route 19 between mile markers 10 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Northwest Webster; Roane
